review_title: Progress at COL with Developing Countries
pros: Since I left COL to start a new ICT for Education based Agency in Ghana, I have followed with admiration how COL has been responding with changes in needs for the member countries. There is more contact on the ground with institutions and the inputs from the latter are well incorporated into each country needs
cons: There are no downsides to identify.

review_title: Good place, not so good management
pros: Employees have postgraduate degrees and are very experienced.
cons: Management micromanages even the littlest aspect of everyone's job.

pros: COL has a professional work environment with colleagues from diverse backgrounds. Most staff have doctorate degrees and are encouraged to work in diverse settings.
cons: Micromanagement is the biggest problem at COL. When management hires a smart professional, management should normally allow such professional to use her/his expertise and experience to perform her/his duties. In the case of COL, management interfere sometimes. This dampens creativity and discourages hard work among professional staff.

review_title: Indeed a good organization to work for!
pros: Multi-cultural, multi-ethnic work culture; emphasize performance but without pressure; good opportunities for professional development
cons: Not being able to communicate achievements as well as the organization can
